text: The 10 Hours of Messina (Italian: 10 ore di Messina or 10 ore notturna messinese) was a sports car race, organized by the Automobile Club d'Italia, held for the first time on 24 August 1952 in the street circuit of Messina, Italy. From 1959 it was replaced by Messina Grand Prix. == Editions== 1961 Formula One world champion Phil Hill won the race in 1956 driving a Ferrari. {| class="wikitable" width=70% style="font-size:90%; text-align:left;" |- !Year!! title: 10 Hours of Messina
